Failures.Name: Cabin Pressure Controller Failed
Failures.Description: The automatic cabin pressure controller has failed. Switch to manual pressurisation control immediately.

Failures.Name: CPC Outside Static Port Blocked
Failures.Description: The CPC's outside static pressure reference port is blocked. Pressurisation scheduling will be erroneous.

Failures.Name: CPC Inside Static Port Blocked
Failures.Description: The CPC's inside cabin static port is blocked. Cabin altitude indication will be unreliable.

Failures.Name: Cabin Pressure Acquisition Module 1 Failed
Failures.Description: CPAM 1 has failed. Backup pressurisation sensing is degraded.

Failures.Name: Cabin Pressure Acquisition Module 2 Failed
Failures.Description: CPAM 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Cabin Air Filter Blocked
Failures.Description: The recirculation air filter is blocked. Cabin ventilation is reduced.

Failures.Name: Vacuum Ejector Pump Failed
Failures.Description: The vacuum ejector pump has failed. Cabin pressurisation efficiency reduced.

Failures.Name: Primary Outflow Valve Stuck
Failures.Description: The primary outflow valve is stuck in its current position. Manual pressurisation control required.

Failures.Name: Secondary Outflow Valve Stuck
Failures.Description: The secondary outflow valve is stuck in its current position.

Failures.Name: ACU 1 Inlet SOV Stuck
Failures.Description: Air conditioning unit 1 inlet shutoff valve is stuck at its current position.

Failures.Name: ACU 1 Inlet SOV Stuck Open
Failures.Description: Air conditioning unit 1 inlet shutoff valve is stuck fully open. Cannot isolate the pack.

Failures.Name: ACU 1 Cold Air Unit Broken
Failures.Description: The left pack cold air unit has failed. Pack 1 output temperature will be uncontrolled.

Failures.Name: ACU 1 Heat Exchangers Clogged
Failures.Description: Pack 1 heat exchangers are clogged. Pack 1 cooling efficiency severely reduced.

Failures.Name: ACU 1 Temperature Controller Failed
Failures.Description: Pack 1 automatic temperature controller has failed. Manual temperature management required.

Failures.Name: ACU 2 Inlet SOV Stuck
Failures.Description: Air conditioning unit 2 inlet shutoff valve is stuck at its current position.

Failures.Name: ACU 2 Cold Air Unit Broken
Failures.Description: The right pack cold air unit has failed.

Failures.Name: ACU 2 Temperature Controller Failed
Failures.Description: Pack 2 automatic temperature controller has failed.

Failures.Name: Cabin Pressure Leak — 500 ft/min
Failures.Description: Cabin is leaking at ~500 ft/min. You have several minutes — begin descent planning now.

Failures.Name: Cabin Pressure Leak — 1000 ft/min
Failures.Description: Cabin is leaking at ~1000 ft/min. Initiate descent without delay.

Failures.Name: Rapid Cabin Depressurisation
Failures.Description: Cabin is losing pressure rapidly. Don oxygen masks and execute emergency descent immediately.

Failures.Name: Flight Control Computer 1A Failed
Failures.Description: FCC 1A has failed. Autopilot capability degraded — expect mode reversions.

Failures.Name: Flight Control Computer 1B Failed
Failures.Description: FCC 1B has failed. Cross-check autopilot status.

Failures.Name: Flight Control Computer 2A Failed
Failures.Description: FCC 2A has failed. Cross-check autopilot modes and revert as required.

Failures.Name: Flight Control Computer 2B Failed
Failures.Description: FCC 2B has failed.

Failures.Name: Autothrottle System Failed
Failures.Description: The autothrottle system has failed completely. Manual thrust management required for all phases.

Failures.Name: Left ATS Mode Select Device Failed
Failures.Description: Left ATS MSD has failed. Autothrottle engagement from left side unavailable.

Failures.Name: Right ATS Mode Select Device Failed
Failures.Description: Right ATS MSD has failed.

Failures.Name: Left ATS Servo Motor Failed
Failures.Description: Left autothrottle servo motor has failed. Left thrust lever will not respond to ATS commands.

Failures.Name: Right ATS Servo Motor Failed
Failures.Description: Right autothrottle servo motor has failed.

Failures.Name: Autopilot Aileron Servo Failed
Failures.Description: The autopilot aileron servo has failed. Lateral autopilot modes are unavailable.

Failures.Name: Autopilot Aileron Servo Runaway
Failures.Description: The autopilot aileron servo has runaway. Disconnect autopilot immediately and counter with full opposite aileron.

Failures.Name: Autopilot Elevator Servo Failed
Failures.Description: The autopilot elevator servo has failed. Pitch autopilot modes are unavailable.

Failures.Name: Autopilot Elevator Servo Runaway
Failures.Description: The autopilot elevator servo has runaway. Disconnect autopilot immediately — pitch upset probable.

Failures.Name: Yaw Damper Channel 1 Failed
Failures.Description: Yaw damper channel 1 has failed. Some Dutch roll tendency may develop at altitude.

Failures.Name: Yaw Damper Channel 2 Failed
Failures.Description: Yaw damper channel 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Both Yaw Dampers Failed
Failures.Description: Both yaw damper channels have failed simultaneously. Pronounced Dutch roll tendency — reduce speed and consider diverting.

Failures.Name: Transponder 1 / TCAS Failed
Failures.Description: ATC 1 transponder and TCAS computer (TSS-4100) have failed. TCAS protection is lost.

Failures.Name: Transponder 2 Failed
Failures.Description: ATC 2 transponder (TDR-94D) has failed. Verify TCAS remains operational on transponder 1.

Failures.Name: VHF Comm 1 Failed (Hard)
Failures.Description: VHF comm 1 radio has failed outright. No audio input or output. Switch to comm 2.

Failures.Name: VHF Comm 1 Failed (Silent)
Failures.Description: VHF comm 1 radio has failed silently — the controller appears alive but no signal is transmitted or received.

Failures.Name: VHF Comm 2 Failed (Hard)
Failures.Description: VHF comm 2 radio has failed outright.

Failures.Name: VHF Comm 2 Failed (Silent)
Failures.Description: VHF comm 2 has failed silently.

Failures.Name: VHF Comm 3 Failed
Failures.Description: VHF comm 3 radio has failed.

Failures.Name: HF Comm 1 Failed
Failures.Description: HF comm 1 radio has failed. Oceanic SELCAL coverage may be affected.

Failures.Name: HF Comm 2 Failed
Failures.Description: HF comm 2 radio has failed.

Failures.Name: Communications Management Unit Failed
Failures.Description: The CMU has failed. ACARS and datalink services are unavailable.

Failures.Name: AC Generator 1 Failed
Failures.Description: AC Generator 1 has failed. Electrical loads have transferred to Generator 2. Monitor system carefully.

Failures.Name: Generator 1 Voltage Regulation Failed
Failures.Description: Generator 1 voltage regulation has failed. Expect bus voltage fluctuations.

Failures.Name: AC Generator 2 Failed
Failures.Description: AC Generator 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Generator 2 Voltage Regulation Failed
Failures.Description: Generator 2 voltage regulation has failed.

Failures.Name: AC Bus 1 Open Circuit
Failures.Description: AC Bus 1 has an open circuit fault. All connected equipment has lost power.

Failures.Name: AC Bus 2 Open Circuit
Failures.Description: AC Bus 2 has an open circuit fault.

Failures.Name: AC Essential Bus Open Circuit
Failures.Description: AC Essential Bus has an open circuit. Essential AC-powered systems have lost power.

Failures.Name: Air-Driven Generator Failed
Failures.Description: The emergency ADG has failed. Emergency electrical power generation is unavailable if deployed.

Failures.Name: ADG Spurious Auto-Deployment
Failures.Description: The ADG auto-deploy control unit has commanded a spurious deployment. The ram air turbine has deployed unexpectedly.

Failures.Name: TRU 1 Failed
Failures.Description: Transformer Rectifier Unit 1 has failed. DC Bus 1 is now sourced from TRU 2.

Failures.Name: TRU 2 Failed
Failures.Description: Transformer Rectifier Unit 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: DC Bus 1 Open Circuit
Failures.Description: DC Bus 1 has an open circuit. Multiple systems powered by this bus have failed.

Failures.Name: DC Bus 2 Open Circuit
Failures.Description: DC Bus 2 has an open circuit.

Failures.Name: DC Essential Bus Open Circuit
Failures.Description: DC Essential Bus has an open circuit. Essential DC equipment has lost power.

Failures.Name: Emergency DC Bus Open Circuit
Failures.Description: The emergency DC bus has an open circuit. Last-resort emergency equipment may be unavailable.

Failures.Name: Main Battery Failed
Failures.Description: Main battery has failed outright. No battery backup for DC emergency power.

Failures.Name: Main Battery Low Voltage
Failures.Description: Main battery is showing low voltage. Battery backup capacity is significantly reduced.

Failures.Name: APU Battery Failed
Failures.Description: APU battery has failed. APU start from battery power is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Engine 1 Zone A Fire (1-Shot Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 1 zone A. One fire extinguisher shot will clear this fire. Execute engine fire checklist immediately.

Failures.Name: Engine 1 Zone A Fire (2-Shot Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 1 zone A. Requires both fire extinguisher shots. Use them wisely.

Failures.Name: Engine 1 Zone A Fire (Non-Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 1 zone A — fire cannot be extinguished. Shutdown immediately and land as soon as possible. This is a MAYDAY.

Failures.Name: Engine 1 Zone B Fire (1-Shot Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 1 zone B. One fire extinguisher shot will clear this fire.

Failures.Name: Engine 1 Zone B Fire (Non-Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 1 zone B — unextinguishable. Shutdown and divert immediately.

Failures.Name: Engine 2 Zone A Fire (1-Shot Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 2 zone A. One fire extinguisher shot will clear this fire. Execute engine fire checklist immediately.

Failures.Name: Engine 2 Zone A Fire (2-Shot Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 2 zone A. Requires both fire extinguisher shots.

Failures.Name: Engine 2 Zone A Fire (Non-Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 2 zone A — fire cannot be extinguished. This is a MAYDAY.

Failures.Name: Engine 2 Zone B Fire (1-Shot Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 2 zone B. One extinguisher shot will clear this fire.

Failures.Name: Engine 2 Zone B Fire (Non-Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: FIRE warning: engine 2 zone B — unextinguishable. Shutdown and divert immediately.

Failures.Name: APU Fire (Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: APU FIRE warning. Shut down APU and discharge fire extinguisher.

Failures.Name: APU Fire (Non-Extinguishable)
Failures.Description: APU FIRE warning — fire cannot be extinguished. Consider landing immediately.

Failures.Name: Left Rudder Pedals Jammed
Failures.Description: Left rudder pedals are jammed in place. Rudder input from the left seat is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Right Rudder Pedals Jammed
Failures.Description: Right rudder pedals are jammed in place.

Failures.Name: Left Control Wheel Jammed
Failures.Description: Left control wheel is jammed. Lateral control from the left seat is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Left Control Column Jammed
Failures.Description: Left control column is jammed. Pitch control from the left seat is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Left Aileron Cables Broken
Failures.Description: Left aileron control cables have broken. No lateral input from the left aileron.

Failures.Name: Right Aileron Cables Broken
Failures.Description: Right aileron control cables have broken.

Failures.Name: Left Aileron Cables Reversed
Failures.Description: Left aileron control cables are connected backwards. Left lateral inputs will produce reversed roll response.

Failures.Name: Left Elevator Cables Broken
Failures.Description: Left elevator control cables have broken. Pitch authority is significantly degraded.

Failures.Name: Right Elevator Cables Broken
Failures.Description: Right elevator control cables have broken.

Failures.Name: Left Rudder Cables Broken
Failures.Description: Left rudder control cables have broken. Directional control authority degraded.

Failures.Name: Rudder Jammed
Failures.Description: Rudder is jammed and cannot move from its current position. Directional control by differential thrust only.

Failures.Name: Rudder Trim Runaway
Failures.Description: Rudder trim has runaway. The aircraft will yaw uncontrollably until manually overpowered.

Failures.Name: Aileron Trim Runaway
Failures.Description: Aileron trim has runaway. The aircraft will roll uncontrollably — disconnect autopilot and overpower immediately.

Failures.Name: Stab Trim Channel 1 Runaway
Failures.Description: Horizontal stabiliser trim channel 1 has runaway. Pitch may be uncontrollable — retard thrust and counter with elevator immediately.

Failures.Name: Stab Trim Channel 2 Runaway
Failures.Description: Horizontal stabiliser trim channel 2 has runaway.

Failures.Name: Stab Trim Channel 1 Failed
Failures.Description: Horizontal stabiliser trim channel 1 has failed. Trim authority is reduced.

Failures.Name: Stab Trim Channel 2 Failed
Failures.Description: Horizontal stabiliser trim channel 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Flight Spoiler Deployed
Failures.Description: Left flight spoiler has deployed uncommanded. Significant roll and drag asymmetry — reduce speed.

Failures.Name: Right Flight Spoiler Deployed
Failures.Description: Right flight spoiler has deployed uncommanded.

Failures.Name: Flaps Motor 1 Failed
Failures.Description: Flaps motor 1 has failed. Flap extension/retraction may be slower or asymmetric.

Failures.Name: Flaps Motor 1 Uncommanded Extension
Failures.Description: Flaps motor 1 is commanding uncommanded flap extension. Expect asymmetry — act quickly.

Failures.Name: Flaps Motor 1 Uncommanded Retraction
Failures.Description: Flaps motor 1 is commanding uncommanded flap retraction.

Failures.Name: Left Flaps Jammed (Asymmetry)
Failures.Description: Left flap surface has jammed. Asymmetric flap extension — do not attempt to move flaps further.

Failures.Name: Right Flaps Jammed (Asymmetry)
Failures.Description: Right flap surface has jammed creating asymmetric flap configuration.

Failures.Name: Stick Pusher Failed
Failures.Description: The stall protection stick pusher has failed. No automatic pusher response to stall — fly with extra care near low-speed limits.

Failures.Name: Left AOA Vane False High Reading
Failures.Description: Left AOA vane is giving a falsely high angle-of-attack reading. Stall protection system may respond to a phantom stall.

Failures.Name: Right AOA Vane False High Reading
Failures.Description: Right AOA vane is giving a falsely high angle-of-attack reading.

Failures.Name: Auxiliary Fuel Tank Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Auxiliary fuel tank is slowly losing fuel. Monitor total quantity and plan accordingly.

Failures.Name: Auxiliary Fuel Tank Fast Leak
Failures.Description: Auxiliary fuel tank is rapidly losing fuel. Immediate divert required.

Failures.Name: Left Main Fuel Tank Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Left main fuel tank is slowly leaking. Monitor fuel asymmetry — crossfeed may be required.

Failures.Name: Left Main Fuel Tank Fast Leak
Failures.Description: Left main fuel tank is rapidly losing fuel. Divert immediately.

Failures.Name: Right Main Fuel Tank Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Right main fuel tank is slowly leaking.

Failures.Name: Right Main Fuel Tank Fast Leak
Failures.Description: Right main fuel tank is rapidly losing fuel.

Failures.Name: Tail Fuel Tank Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Tail tank is slowly leaking. Monitor CG as tail fuel quantity changes.

Failures.Name: Tail Fuel Tank Fast Leak
Failures.Description: Tail tank is rapidly losing fuel. CG shift may be rapid — divert immediately.

Failures.Name: Left Fuel Boost Pump Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine boost pump has failed. Left engine is running on suction feed only — limit altitude.

Failures.Name: Right Fuel Boost Pump Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine boost pump has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Primary Ejector Pump Failed
Failures.Description: Left primary ejector pump has failed. Fuel scavenging efficiency is reduced.

Failures.Name: Right Primary Ejector Pump Failed
Failures.Description: Right primary ejector pump has failed.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic System 1 Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Hydraulic system 1 is slowly losing fluid. Monitor quantity — you have time but not indefinitely.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic System 1 Catastrophic Leak
Failures.Description: Hydraulic system 1 is losing fluid rapidly. Immediate checklist action required — system will be exhausted quickly.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic System 2 Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Hydraulic system 2 is slowly losing fluid.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic System 2 Catastrophic Leak
Failures.Description: Hydraulic system 2 is losing fluid rapidly.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic System 3 Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Hydraulic system 3 is slowly losing fluid.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic System 3 Catastrophic Leak
Failures.Description: Hydraulic system 3 is losing fluid rapidly.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic Engine-Driven Pump 1A Failed
Failures.Description: Engine-driven hydraulic pump 1A has failed. System 1 pressure now maintained by electric pump 1B only.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic Electric Pump 1B Failed
Failures.Description: AC electric hydraulic pump 1B has failed. System 1 pressure now maintained by engine-driven pump only.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic Engine-Driven Pump 2A Failed
Failures.Description: Engine-driven hydraulic pump 2A has failed.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic Electric Pump 2B Failed
Failures.Description: AC electric hydraulic pump 2B has failed.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic Electric Pump 3A Failed
Failures.Description: AC electric hydraulic pump 3A has failed. System 3 pressure now maintained by pump 3B only.

Failures.Name: Hydraulic Electric Pump 3B Failed
Failures.Description: AC electric hydraulic pump 3B has failed.

Failures.Name: Pilot Pitot-Static Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Pilot-side pitot-static heating element has failed. Risk of icing and airspeed errors in IMC.

Failures.Name: Standby Pitot Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Standby pitot heat has failed. Standby airspeed unreliable in icing conditions.

Failures.Name: Left AOA Probe Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Left angle-of-attack probe heater has failed. AOA data unreliable in icing conditions.

Failures.Name: Left Static Port Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Left static port heating element has failed. Altitude and airspeed readings may be erroneous in icing.

Failures.Name: Copilot Pitot-Static Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Copilot-side pitot-static heating element has failed.

Failures.Name: TAT Probe Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Total air temperature probe heat has failed. TAT and SAT readings may be erroneous in icing.

Failures.Name: Right AOA Probe Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Right angle-of-attack probe heater has failed.

Failures.Name: Auxiliary AOA Probe Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Auxiliary AOA probe heat has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Window Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Left side window heat has failed. Window may fog or ice over in cold conditions.

Failures.Name: Left Windshield Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Left windshield heat has failed. Forward visibility may be affected in icing.

Failures.Name: Right Windshield Heat Failed
Failures.Description: Right windshield heat has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Ice Detector Failed
Failures.Description: Left ice detector has failed. Icing conditions will not be automatically annunciated from this detector.

Failures.Name: Right Ice Detector Failed
Failures.Description: Right ice detector has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Ice Detector Cannot Detect Ice
Failures.Description: Left ice detector is operational but cannot detect ice accumulation — silent failure.

Failures.Name: Remote Electronic Unit 1 Failed
Failures.Description: REU 1 has failed. Multiple EICAS indications may be lost or erroneous.

Failures.Name: Remote Electronic Unit 2 Failed
Failures.Description: REU 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Data Concentrator Unit 1A Failed
Failures.Description: DCU 1A has failed. EICAS data from this unit is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Data Concentrator Unit 1B Failed
Failures.Description: DCU 1B has failed.

Failures.Name: Nosewheel Steering Control Unit Failed
Failures.Description: NSCU has failed. Nosewheel steering is unavailable — use differential braking for ground directional control.

Failures.Name: Inboard Anti-Skid Control Unit Failed
Failures.Description: Inboard anti-skid control unit has failed. Do not brake hard on landing — risk of tyre burst.

Failures.Name: Outboard Anti-Skid Control Unit Failed
Failures.Description: Outboard anti-skid control unit has failed.

Failures.Name: Landing Gear Handle Failed
Failures.Description: The landing gear handle has failed. Gear may not respond to commands — prepare for manual gear extension.

Failures.Name: Landing Gear Handle Jammed
Failures.Description: Landing gear handle is jammed in its current position. Cannot cycle landing gear.

Failures.Name: Nose Gear Tyre Puncture
Failures.Description: Both nose gear tyres have punctured. Directional control on landing rollout will be severely affected.

Failures.Name: Left Main Gear Tyre Puncture
Failures.Description: Both left main gear tyres have punctured. Landing rollout directional control will be affected.

Failures.Name: Right Main Gear Tyre Puncture
Failures.Description: Both right main gear tyres have punctured.

Failures.Name: Nose Gear Leg Uplock Failed Open
Failures.Description: Nose gear leg uplock has failed to an open state. Nose gear may extend uncommanded.

Failures.Name: Left Main Gear Leg Uplock Failed Open
Failures.Description: Left main gear leg uplock has failed to an open state. Gear may extend uncommanded.

Failures.Name: Right Main Gear Leg Uplock Failed Open
Failures.Description: Right main gear leg uplock has failed to an open state.

Failures.Name: ADC 1 Pitot Tube Blocked
Failures.Description: ADC 1 pitot tube is blocked. Pilot-side airspeed indication will be stuck or zero.

Failures.Name: ADC 1 Pitot Tube Small Leak
Failures.Description: ADC 1 pitot tube is leaking pressure. Pilot-side airspeed will read slightly low.

Failures.Name: ADC 1 Pitot Tube Large Leak
Failures.Description: ADC 1 pitot tube is leaking significantly. Pilot-side airspeed will read near zero.

Failures.Name: ADC 1 Static System Blocked
Failures.Description: ADC 1 static system is blocked. Altitude and vertical speed indications on the pilot side will be frozen.

Failures.Name: ADC 2 Pitot Tube Blocked
Failures.Description: ADC 2 pitot tube is blocked. Copilot-side airspeed indication will be stuck or zero.

Failures.Name: ADC 2 Pitot Tube Small Leak
Failures.Description: ADC 2 pitot tube is leaking. Copilot-side airspeed reads slightly low.

Failures.Name: Standby Pitot Tube Blocked
Failures.Description: Standby pitot tube is blocked. Standby airspeed will be stuck or zero.

Failures.Name: Air Data Computer 1 Failed
Failures.Description: ADC 1 has failed. PFD 1 air data now sourced from ADC 2. Cross-check with standby instruments.

Failures.Name: Air Data Computer 2 Failed
Failures.Description: ADC 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Heads-Up Display Failed
Failures.Description: The HUD has failed. Revert to head-down instrument scan.

Failures.Name: PFD 1 Failed
Failures.Description: PFD 1 has failed. Pilot must use the MFD in reversionary mode or standby instruments.

Failures.Name: PFD 2 Failed
Failures.Description: PFD 2 has failed. Copilot must use the MFD in reversionary mode.

Failures.Name: MFD 1 Failed
Failures.Description: MFD 1 has failed. Navigation and systems displays from this screen are unavailable.

Failures.Name: MFD 2 Failed
Failures.Description: MFD 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Integrated Standby Instrument Failed
Failures.Description: The ISI has failed. Standby attitude, airspeed and altitude backup is unavailable.

Failures.Name: ISI Attitude Drifting
Failures.Description: ISI attitude indication is randomly drifting. Do not rely on standby attitude reference.

Failures.Name: Radio Altimeter 1 Failed
Failures.Description: Radio altimeter 1 has failed. GPWS/TAWS and decision height alerting will use RA 2 only.

Failures.Name: Radio Altimeter 1 Erratic
Failures.Description: Radio altimeter 1 will randomly read 0 ft. Cross-check with RA 2 near the ground.

Failures.Name: Radio Altimeter 2 Failed
Failures.Description: Radio altimeter 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 1 Failed (Hard)
Failures.Description: VHF NAV 1 radio has failed outright. ILS/VOR guidance on NAV 1 is lost.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 1 VOR/LOC Receiver Failed
Failures.Description: NAV 1 VOR/LOC receiver has failed. ILS localiser and VOR guidance are unavailable on NAV 1.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 1 VOR/LOC Indication Drifting
Failures.Description: NAV 1 VOR/LOC indication is randomly drifting. Do not rely on it for approaches.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 1 Glideslope Receiver Failed
Failures.Description: NAV 1 glideslope receiver has failed. ILS glideslope guidance is unavailable on NAV 1.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 1 Glideslope Indication Drifting
Failures.Description: NAV 1 glideslope indication is randomly drifting. Do not use for precision approaches.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 2 Failed (Hard)
Failures.Description: VHF NAV 2 radio has failed outright.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 2 VOR/LOC Indication Drifting
Failures.Description: NAV 2 VOR/LOC indication is randomly drifting.

Failures.Name: VHF NAV 2 Glideslope Indication Drifting
Failures.Description: NAV 2 glideslope indication is randomly drifting.

Failures.Name: GPS 1 Receiver Failed
Failures.Description: GPS 1 receiver has failed. RNAV approaches requiring GPS 1 are unavailable.

Failures.Name: GPS 2 Receiver Failed
Failures.Description: GPS 2 receiver has failed.

Failures.Name: GPS Accuracy Degraded
Failures.Description: GPS service accuracy is degraded. RNAV approaches may not meet required navigation performance.

Failures.Name: GPS Jamming
Failures.Description: GPS service is being jammed. All GPS-based navigation is unavailable. Revert to conventional navigation.

Failures.Name: Flight Management Computer 1 Failed
Failures.Description: FMC 1 has failed. LNAV/VNAV guidance from FMC 1 is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Flight Management Computer 2 Failed
Failures.Description: FMC 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: FMC Cross-Talk Failed
Failures.Description: Cross-talk between FMCs has failed. Both FMCs are operating independently — they may diverge.

Failures.Name: CDU 1 Failed
Failures.Description: Control Display Unit 1 has failed. FMS input from the left CDU is unavailable.

Failures.Name: CDU 2 Failed
Failures.Description: Control Display Unit 2 has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Oxygen Mask Blocked
Failures.Description: Left crew oxygen mask is blocked. If depressurisation occurs, the left seat has no mask protection.

Failures.Name: Right Oxygen Mask Blocked
Failures.Description: Right crew oxygen mask is blocked.

Failures.Name: Oxygen Tank Slow Leak
Failures.Description: Oxygen tank is slowly leaking. Time-on-oxygen in an emergency depressurisation is reduced.

Failures.Name: Oxygen Tank Fast Leak
Failures.Description: Oxygen tank is leaking quickly. If combined with depressurisation, crew oxygen time is critically short.

Failures.Name: Left 10th Stage Bleed SOV Stuck
Failures.Description: Left 10th stage bleed shutoff valve is stuck. Bleed air management for the left engine is compromised.

Failures.Name: Right 10th Stage Bleed SOV Stuck
Failures.Description: Right 10th stage bleed shutoff valve is stuck.

Failures.Name: Left Wing Anti-Ice Valve Stuck
Failures.Description: Left wing anti-ice valve is stuck. Left wing anti-icing is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Right Wing Anti-Ice Valve Stuck
Failures.Description: Right wing anti-ice valve is stuck.

Failures.Name: APU Starter Failed
Failures.Description: APU starter has failed. APU cannot be started — ground power or engine bleed required.

Failures.Name: APU Extremely Worn Out
Failures.Description: APU is extremely weak and worn out. Output power and bleed capacity are severely limited.

Failures.Name: APU Overspeed
Failures.Description: APU is overspeeding. Automatic shutdown may occur.

Failures.Name: Left Engine N1 Vibration High
Failures.Description: Left engine is experiencing excessive N1 vibration. Monitor closely — consider power reduction.

Failures.Name: Left Engine N2 Vibration High
Failures.Description: Left engine core is experiencing excessive N2 vibration. May indicate bearing damage.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Compressor Stall (Transient)
Failures.Description: Left engine compressor stall — transient, self-clearing. Monitor N1 and ITT for recurrence.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Compressor Stall (Clearable)
Failures.Description: Left engine compressor stall — clearable by reducing power. Act promptly.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Compressor Stall (Non-Clearable)
Failures.Description: Left engine compressor stall — cannot be cleared by any means. Engine shutdown required.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Combustion Instability
Failures.Description: Left engine combustion is unstable. Thrust fluctuations are likely.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Momentary Flameout
Failures.Description: Left engine has flamed out momentarily — relight may be possible. Execute engine relight checklist.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Permanent Flameout
Failures.Description: Left engine has permanently flamed out and will not relight. Single-engine operations required.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Fan Rotor Locked
Failures.Description: Left engine fan rotor shaft is locked. The engine is seized — unrecoverable.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Core Rotor Locked
Failures.Description: Left engine core rotor shaft is locked. The engine is seized — unrecoverable.

Failures.Name: Right Engine N1 Vibration High
Failures.Description: Right engine is experiencing excessive N1 vibration. Monitor closely.

Failures.Name: Right Engine N2 Vibration High
Failures.Description: Right engine core is experiencing excessive N2 vibration.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Compressor Stall (Clearable)
Failures.Description: Right engine compressor stall — clearable by reducing power.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Compressor Stall (Non-Clearable)
Failures.Description: Right engine compressor stall — cannot be cleared. Engine shutdown required.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Combustion Instability
Failures.Description: Right engine combustion is unstable. Thrust fluctuations likely.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Momentary Flameout
Failures.Description: Right engine has flamed out momentarily — relight may be possible.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Permanent Flameout
Failures.Description: Right engine has permanently flamed out and will not relight.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Fan Rotor Locked
Failures.Description: Right engine fan rotor shaft is locked. The engine is seized — unrecoverable.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Core Rotor Locked
Failures.Description: Right engine core rotor shaft is locked. Unrecoverable.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Fuel Control Erratic
Failures.Description: Left engine FCU is erratic. Thrust output will be unpredictable — manual intervention may be required.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Fuel Control Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine fuel control unit has failed. Engine thrust is uncontrollable — shutdown required.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Fuel Nozzles Clogged
Failures.Description: Left engine fuel nozzles are clogged. Combustion efficiency is reduced — monitor ITT.

Failures.Name: Left Engine N1 Control Amplifier Erratic
Failures.Description: Left N1 control amplifier is erratic. Thrust setting may fluctuate.

Failures.Name: Left Engine N1 Control Stuck at Minimum
Failures.Description: Left engine N1 control amplifier is stuck at minimum power. Left engine thrust is at idle.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Fuel Control Erratic
Failures.Description: Right engine FCU is erratic. Thrust output will be unpredictable.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Fuel Control Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine fuel control unit has failed. Shutdown required.

Failures.Name: Right Engine N1 Control Stuck at Minimum
Failures.Description: Right engine N1 control amplifier is stuck at minimum power.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Ignition System A Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine ignition system A has failed. Relight capability is degraded.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Ignition System B Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine ignition system B has failed.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Ignition System A Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine ignition system A has failed.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Ignition System B Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine ignition system B has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Thrust Lever Jammed
Failures.Description: Left thrust lever is jammed at its current position. Cannot change left engine thrust setting.

Failures.Name: Left Thrust Control Cable Broken
Failures.Description: Left engine thrust control cable has broken. Left engine is stuck at current FCU setting.

Failures.Name: Right Thrust Lever Jammed
Failures.Description: Right thrust lever is jammed at its current position.

Failures.Name: Right Thrust Control Cable Broken
Failures.Description: Right engine thrust control cable has broken.

Failures.Name: Left Engine N1 Indication Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine N1 gauge has failed. Actual engine thrust is unaffected — use ITT and N2 for reference.

Failures.Name: Left Engine N1 Indication Erratic
Failures.Description: Left engine N1 gauge is showing erratic readings. Actual thrust is unaffected.

Failures.Name: Left Engine ITT Indication Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine ITT gauge has failed. Temperature monitoring for the left engine is unavailable.

Failures.Name: Left Engine ITT Indication Erratic
Failures.Description: Left engine ITT gauge is erratic. Monitor N1 and N2 closely.

Failures.Name: Right Engine N1 Indication Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine N1 gauge has failed.

Failures.Name: Right Engine N1 Indication Erratic
Failures.Description: Right engine N1 gauge is showing erratic readings.

Failures.Name: Right Engine ITT Indication Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine ITT gauge has failed.

Failures.Name: Left Reverser Jammed in Position
Failures.Description: Left engine reverser is jammed in its current position. Do not attempt to cycle it.

Failures.Name: Left Reverser Locks Open
Failures.Description: Left engine reverser locks have failed to an open state. Reverser may deploy unexpectedly.

Failures.Name: Left Reverser Uncommanded Deployment
Failures.Description: Left thrust reverser has deployed in flight. Catastrophic asymmetric drag — reduce thrust immediately and counter with full right rudder.

Failures.Name: Right Reverser Jammed in Position
Failures.Description: Right engine reverser is jammed in its current position.

Failures.Name: Right Reverser Locks Open
Failures.Description: Right engine reverser locks have failed open. Reverser may deploy unexpectedly.

Failures.Name: Right Reverser Uncommanded Deployment
Failures.Description: Right thrust reverser has deployed in flight. Catastrophic asymmetric drag — this is immediately life-threatening.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Oil Pump Failed
Failures.Description: Left engine oil pump has failed. Engine oil pressure will drop — shutdown required to prevent seizure.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Oil Pump Weak
Failures.Description: Left engine oil pump is producing low pressure. Monitor oil pressure — shutdown if it falls below limits.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Oil Burning (Gas Path Leak)
Failures.Description: Left engine is burning oil too quickly due to a gas path seal leak. Oil quantity will deplete — monitor closely.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Oil Pump Failed
Failures.Description: Right engine oil pump has failed. Shutdown required to prevent engine seizure.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Oil Pump Weak
Failures.Description: Right engine oil pump is producing low pressure.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Oil Burning (Gas Path Leak)
Failures.Description: Right engine is burning oil too quickly due to a gas path seal leak.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Hung Start
Failures.Description: Left engine is hung during start — N2 has stabilised below idle due to weak cranking. Abort start.

Failures.Name: Left Engine Hot Start
Failures.Description: Left engine is experiencing a hot start — ITT is rising rapidly. Monitor and abort if limits are approached.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Hung Start
Failures.Description: Right engine is hung during start.

Failures.Name: Right Engine Hot Start
Failures.Description: Right engine is experiencing a hot start.

Failures.Name: Birdstrike — Left Windshield
Failures.Description: Birdstrike has shattered the outer pane of the left windshield. Forward visibility is impaired.

Failures.Name: Birdstrike — Left Engine (Fatal)
Failures.Description: Birdstrike has caused a non-recoverable left engine failure. Single-engine operations required.

Failures.Name: Birdstrike — Right Engine (Fatal)
Failures.Description: Birdstrike has caused a non-recoverable right engine failure.

Failures.Name: Birdstrike — Left Pitot Blocked
Failures.Description: Birdstrike has blocked the left pitot tube. Pilot-side airspeed indication is unreliable.

Failures.Name: Birdstrike — Right Pitot Blocked
Failures.Description: Birdstrike has blocked the right pitot tube.

Failures.Name: Microburst / Windshear Encounter
Failures.Description: The aircraft has encountered a microburst. Severe windshear — maximum thrust, follow escape manoeuvre.

Failures.Name: Cockpit Smoke (Non-Clearable)
Failures.Description: Smoke in the cockpit that cannot be cleared. Don oxygen masks and initiate emergency descent.

Failures.Name: Cockpit Smoke from Left Pack
Failures.Description: Smoke in the cockpit sourced from the left air conditioning pack. Shut off left pack and check for clearance.

Failures.Name: Cockpit Smoke from Right Pack
Failures.Description: Smoke in the cockpit sourced from the right air conditioning pack.

Failures.Name: Baggage Bay Smoke
Failures.Description: Smoke detected in the baggage bay. Initiate cargo smoke checklist — consider diverting.
